oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.mapred.input

Class SpatialIndexInputFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.mapred.input.SpatialIndexInputFormat

  • public class SpatialIndexInputFormat
extends <any>
    InputFormat for reading a Spatial Index generated with the Vector API.
    This class delivers the records stored into the index as Text/RecordInfo key/value pairs instead of returning the whole RTreeWritable value.
    Additionally, a spatial filter can be performed over the input data set; to do that, it is needed to specify a SpatialOperationConfig.
    If required, an InputFormat-specific SpatialOperationConfig can be configured to be used only by this InputFormat by calling setFilterSpatialOperationConfig(SpatialOperationConfig, Configuration).
    If no spatial configuration is defined, a SpatialOperation.AnyInteract will be performed taking as query window the boundaries defined in the SpatialConfig (if any).
    Author:
    hsaucedo

      • CONF_NON_GEODETIC_FILTER

        public static final java.lang.String CONF_NON_GEODETIC_FILTER
        Boolean job configuration value. When set to true, forces the filter operation to be non-geodetic despite the srid or the isGeodetic setting.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setFilterSpatialOperationConfig

        public static void setFilterSpatialOperationConfig(SpatialOperationConfig spatialOpConf,
                                                   Configuration conf)
        Sets an input-format specific SpatialOperationConfig.
        Parameters:
        spatialOpConf - a spatial operation configuration defining how the data should be spatially filtered.
        conf - the job's configuration.

      • setFilterSpatialOperationConfig

        public static void setFilterSpatialOperationConfig(SpatialOperationConfig spatialOpConf,
                                                   java.lang.Integer dataSetId,
                                                   Configuration conf)
        Sets an input-format-dataset specific SpatialOperationConfig. Used when there are multiple input data sets that use SpatialIndexInputFormat with different filter requirements.
        Parameters:
        spatialOpConf - a spatial operation configuration defining how the data should be spatially filtered.
        dataSetId - the data set id as assigned by MultipleInputsConfig
        conf - the job's configuration
